title: Single Predictor
summary: Forecasts the performance of selected trading strategies for a specific stock in the upcoming period.
whatItDoes: The Single Predictor forecasts the performance of selected trading strategies for a specific stock in the upcoming period, displaying results in a bar graph.
inputs: Stock: Select one stock (e.g., ACC.NS).
Metric: Choose one metric (e.g., Sharpe Ratio, Total Return).
Strategies: Pick multiple strategies (e.g., SMA10 over SMA50, RSI).
output: A bar graph where the X-axis lists the selected strategies and the Y-axis shows predicted metric scores.
whyUseIt: Predictive Power: Offers forward-looking insights to identify strategies likely to succeed, unlike historical analysis tools.
Strategy Ranking: Directly compares strategies to guide your next trade.
howItHelps: It simplifies selecting high-potential strategies by showing which are expected to perform best for a stock in the near future.
howToUse: Choose a stock and a metric.
Select multiple strategies to compare.
Review the bar graph—higher bars indicate better predicted performance.

title: Heatmap
summary: Displays the performance of multiple strategies across multiple stocks for a single metric at a chosen historical point.
whatItDoes: The Heatmap displays the performance of multiple strategies across multiple stocks for a single metric at a chosen historical point.
inputs: History: Set a historical point (0 to 99) using a slider.
Stocks: Select up to 10 stocks from a multi-select dropdown.
Strategies: Choose up to 10 strategies from a multi-select dropdown.
Metric: Pick one metric from a single-select dropdown.
output:
A heatmap:
- Rows: Strategies (e.g., Bollinger Bands).
- Columns: Stocks (e.g., ABBOTTINDIA).
- Cells: Metric performance values for the strategy-stock combination.
whyUseIt: Broad Comparison: Quickly compare many strategies across multiple stocks to identify top performers.
Pattern Recognition: Spot trends or outliers across a portfolio at a glance.
howItHelps: It helps you find strategies that work well across various stocks, supporting diversification or focused investments.
howToUse: Set the history slider to a specific point.
Select up to 10 stocks and 10 strategies.
Choose a metric.
Check the heatmap—darker or lighter cells (per the color scale) indicate better or worse performance.

title: Radial Graph
summary: Shows how multiple strategies perform for a single stock across multiple metrics at a specific historical point.
whatItDoes: The Radial Graph shows how multiple strategies perform for a single stock across multiple metrics at a specific historical point.
inputs: History: Set a historical point (0 to 99) with a slider.
Stock: Select one stock from a single-select dropdown.
Strategies: Choose up to 8 strategies from a multi-select dropdown.
output:
A radial graph:
- Spokes: Represent strategies.
- Colored Lines: Represent metrics (e.g., Sharpe Ratio, Total Return).
- Intersection Points: Show performance scores (center is negative, middle is zero, outer is positive).
whyUseIt: Multi-Metric Insight: Evaluates a stock’s strategies across several metrics simultaneously, revealing trade-offs like risk versus return.
Focused Analysis: Deepens understanding of one stock’s strategy performance.
howItHelps: It guides strategy selection by showing which strategies balance multiple performance metrics for a specific stock.
howToUse: Set the history slider.
Select one stock and up to 8 strategies.
Review the graph—points farther from the center (for positive metrics) or closer (for negative metrics) indicate better performance.

title: Metric vs History Bar Graph
summary: Tracks the historical performance of a single strategy for one stock and one metric across all historical points.
whatItDoes: This bar graph tracks the historical performance of a single strategy for one stock and one metric across all historical points.
inputs: Stock: Select one stock from a single-select dropdown.
Strategy: Choose one strategy from a single-select dropdown.
Metric: Pick one metric from a single-select dropdown.
output:
A bar graph:
- X-axis: Historical points (History 0 to 99, with higher history numbers on the left).
- Y-axis: Metric values.
whyUseIt: Historical Trends: Reveals how a strategy’s performance evolves over time, highlighting consistency or volatility.
Long-Term View: Shows performance across all available history points.
howItHelps: It helps assess whether a strategy is reliably effective for a stock over time, aiding long-term planning.
howToUse: Select a stock, strategy, and metric.
Check the bars—higher bars at different history points indicate stronger past performance.

title: Metric vs Stock Bar Graph
summary: Compares a single strategy’s performance across multiple stocks for one metric at a specific historical point.
whatItDoes: This bar graph compares a single strategy’s performance across multiple stocks for one metric at a specific historical point.
inputs: History: Set a historical point (0 to 99) with a slider.
Stocks: Select up to 10 stocks from a multi-select dropdown.
Strategy: Choose one strategy from a single-select dropdown.
Metric: Pick one metric from a single-select dropdown.
output:
A bar graph:
- X-axis: Lists the selected stocks.
- Y-axis: Shows metric values.
whyUseIt: Cross-Stock Comparison: Identifies which stocks perform best with a strategy, unlike the time-focused Metric vs History graph.
Portfolio Optimization: Helps select the best stocks for a given strategy.
howItHelps: It guides stock selection by showing where a strategy performs strongest at a specific time.
howToUse: Set the history slider.
Select up to 10 stocks, one strategy, and one metric.
Review the bars—higher bars indicate better performance for specific stocks.

title: Heatmap
summary: Displays the performance of strategy pairs across multiple stocks for a single metric.
whatItDoes: The Heatmap shows the performance of strategy pairs (one fixed strategy paired with multiple others) across multiple stocks for a single metric at a chosen historical point.
inputs: History: Set a historical point (0 to 99) using a slider.
Stocks: Select up to 10 stocks from a multi-select dropdown.
Condition_1: Choose one fixed strategy from a single-select dropdown.
Condition_2: Pick up to 10 strategies to pair with Condition_1 from a multi-select dropdown.
Metric: Select one metric from a single-select dropdown.
output:
A heatmap:
- Rows: Strategy pairs (Condition_1 + each Condition_2).
- Columns: Stocks.
- Cells: Metric performance values for the pair-stock combination.
whyUseIt: Broad Pair Comparison: Evaluates multiple strategy pairs across several stocks, identifying top-performing combinations.
Portfolio-Wide Insights: Spots patterns in pair performance across different stocks.
howItHelps: It helps you find strategy pairs that work well across your portfolio, enhancing diversification or focus.
howToUse: Set the history slider.
Select up to 10 stocks, one Condition_1, up to 10 Condition_2 strategies, and a metric.
Check the heatmap—darker or lighter cells (per the color scale) indicate better or worse pair performance.

title: Radial Graph
summary: Shows how strategy pairs perform for a single stock across multiple metrics.
whatItDoes: The Radial Graph displays how strategy pairs perform for a single stock across multiple metrics at a specific historical point.
inputs: History: Set a historical point (0 to 99) with a slider.
Stock: Select one stock from a single-select dropdown.
Condition_1: Choose one fixed strategy from a single-select dropdown.
Condition_2: Pick up to 8 strategies to pair with Condition_1 from a multi-select dropdown.
output:
A radial graph:
- Spokes: Strategy pairs (Condition_1 + each Condition_2).
- Colored Lines: Metrics (e.g., Sharpe Ratio, Total Return).
- Intersection Points: Performance scores (center is negative, middle is zero, outer is positive).
whyUseIt: Multi-Metric Pair Analysis: Assesses how pairs balance across metrics like risk and return for one stock.
Deep Pair Insights: Focuses on pair performance for a specific stock, offering detailed evaluation.
howItHelps: It guides you in selecting strategy pairs that optimize multiple performance metrics for a stock.
howToUse: Set the history slider.
Select one stock, one Condition_1, and up to 8 Condition_2 strategies.
Review the graph—points farther from the center (for positive metrics) indicate stronger pair performance.

title: Metric vs History Bar Graph
summary: Tracks the historical performance of a strategy pair for one stock over time.
whatItDoes: This bar graph tracks the historical performance of a specific strategy pair for one stock and one metric across all historical points.
inputs: Stock: Select one stock from a single-select dropdown.
Condition_1: Choose one strategy from a single-select dropdown.
Condition_2: Pick one strategy to pair with Condition_1 from a single-select dropdown.
Metric: Select one metric from a single-select dropdown.
output:
A bar graph:
- X-axis: Historical points (History 0 to 99, with higher history numbers on the left).
- Y-axis: Metric values.
whyUseIt: Pair Consistency Tracking: Shows how a strategy pair performs over time, revealing long-term reliability.
Historical Depth: Analyzes pair performance across all available history points.
howItHelps: It confirms whether a strategy pair is consistently effective for a stock, supporting long-term strategy planning.
howToUse: Select a stock, two strategies (Condition_1 and Condition_2), and a metric.
Check the bars—higher bars at different history points indicate stronger past pair performance.

title: Metric vs Stock Bar Graph
summary: Compares a strategy pair’s performance across multiple stocks.
whatItDoes: This bar graph compares a specific strategy pair’s performance across multiple stocks for one metric at a chosen historical point.
inputs: History: Set a historical point (0 to 99) with a slider.
Stocks: Select up to 10 stocks from a multi-select dropdown.
Condition_1: Choose one strategy from a single-select dropdown.
Condition_2: Pick one strategy to pair with Condition_1 from a single-select dropdown.
Metric: Select one metric from a single-select dropdown.
output:
A bar graph:
- X-axis: Lists the selected stocks.
- Y-axis: Shows metric values.
whyUseIt: Pair Stock Comparison: Identifies which stocks perform best with a specific strategy pair, unlike the time-focused version.
Portfolio Fit: Helps select stocks that maximize pair performance.
howItHelps: It guides stock selection for a strategy pair, optimizing your portfolio for specific combinations.
howToUse: Set the history slider.
Select up to 10 stocks, two strategies (Condition_1 and Condition_2), and a metric.
Review the bars—higher bars indicate better pair performance for specific stocks.

title: Chord Diagram
summary: Visualizes the performance synergy of strategy pairs for a single stock and metric.
whatItDoes: The Chord Diagram visualizes the performance of strategy pairs (from a selected pool of 3 to 6 strategies) for one stock and one metric at a specific historical point.
inputs: History: Set a historical point (0 to 99) with a slider.
Stock: Select one stock from a single-select dropdown.
Metric: Choose one metric from a single-select dropdown.
Strategies: Pick 3 to 6 strategies from a multi-select dropdown.
output:
A chord diagram:
- Arcs: Represent individual strategies.
- Bands: Connect pairs of strategies, with thickness showing performance strength.
whyUseIt: Intuitive Pair Insights: Visually highlights which strategy pairs work best together through band thickness, offering a unique perspective compared to grid or spoke-based subtools.
Synergy Visualization: Quickly identifies complementary strategies for a stock, simplifying complex pair analysis.
howItHelps: It makes it easy to spot high-performing strategy pairs, helping you build synergistic trading approaches for a stock.
howToUse: Set the history slider.
Select one stock, one metric, and 3 to 6 strategies.
Review the diagram—thicker bands between arcs indicate stronger pair performance.

title: Backtester
summary: Evaluates the historical performance of a custom combination of strategies for one stock over a specified period, displaying results in a table.
whatItDoes: The Backtester evaluates the historical performance of a custom combination of strategies for one stock over a specified period, displaying results in a table.
inputs: Stock: Select one stock from a single-select dropdown.
Stop-Loss: Enter a percentage (0 to 100).
Brokerage: Enter a percentage (0 to 100).
Strategies: Choose a combination of strategies from a multi-select dropdown.
Duration: Enter a valid integer value for the trading cycle length.
output: A table showing seven metrics (e.g., Sharpe Ratio, Total Return, Profitable Trades).
whyUseIt: Custom Strategy Testing: Tests your unique strategy combinations, unlike predefined analyses in other tools.
Realistic Simulation: Factors in stop-loss and brokerage for practical performance insights.
howItHelps: It validates your custom strategy mix, showing how it would have performed historically to refine your approach.
howToUse: Select a stock, set stop-loss and brokerage percentages, choose strategies, and specify a duration.
Review the table—check metrics to assess the strategy combination’s historical performance.
